questions.text: Idiopathic scoliosis is:

options.label: C
options.text: Lateral curvature with rotation of spine

questions.correct_answer: C. Lateral curvature with rotation of spine
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Lateral curvature with rotation of spine

questions.text: A 70-year-old male with a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes presents to the office with a 6-week history of left hip pain with ambulation. Initial ESR was 120. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in the management of the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Resection of the proximal femur and reconstruction with a proximal femur replacement

options.label: C
options.text: Multiple myeloma panel and CT of the chest, abdomen and pelvis

options.label: D
options.text: CT and MRI of the femur

questions.correct_answer: C. Multiple myeloma panel and CT of the chest, abdomen and pelvis
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Multiple myeloma panel and CT of the chest, abdomen and pelvis

options.label: A

options.label: D

questions.text: Pain in Paget’s disease is relieved best by:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Calcitonin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bisphosphonates are drug of choice and calcitonin is used to relieve pain.

questions.text: Joint erosion is not a feature of:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Systemic Lupus Erythematosus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ While joint involvement can occur in SLE, erosive changes are generally less common compared to conditions like rheumatoid arthritis or psoriatic arthritis.
  • ➤ While joint involvement can occur in SLE, erosive changes are generally less common compared to conditions like rheumatoid arthritis or psoriatic arthritis.

questions.text: Ottawa ankle rules are used to:

options.label: C
options.text: Decide on need of X-rays for possible fracture

options.label: D
options.text: Decide on immediate vs delayed treatment of ankle dislocation

questions.correct_answer: C. Decide on need of X-rays for possible fracture
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Decide on need of X-rays for possible fracture

questions.text: Post contrast MRI of the spine of a 40-year-old man who presented with chronic back pain has been shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Bony ankylosis is noticed in case of:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Pyogenic arthritis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chronic cases of pyogenic arthritis may result in joint damage over time if the infection is not treated properly. Bony ankylosis is the characteristic feature of pyogenic arthritis due to infection and inflammation.
  • ➤ Chronic cases of pyogenic arthritis may result in joint damage over time if the infection is not treated properly.
  • ➤ Bony ankylosis is the characteristic feature of pyogenic arthritis due to infection and inflammation.

questions.text: What is the diagnosis?
A pole vaulter had a fall during pole vaulting and had paralysis of the arm. Which of the following investigations gives the best recovery prognosis?
Absence of lamina dura in the alveolus occurs in:
The following pelvic X-ray was seen in a patient. All the following signs will be present except:

A 4-year-old child presented to the clinic with a history of fall on outstretched hand. Radiographs revealed a broken anterior cortex with an intact posterior cortex of the radius with an exaggerated bowing of the radius. The fracture sustained is known as:

A patient who used to work out regularly at the gym gradually developed pain in the hip which is aggravated while squatting. He gives history of regular steroid and creatine use over last six months. There is flattening of femoral head and subchondral cysts were seen on X-ray. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 46-year-old male presents with lesion involving epiphyseal region of lower end femur. The multinucleated giant cells and mononuclear cells can be seen on histopathology. What is the most probable diagnosis?
Periosteal reaction in a case of acute osteomyelitis can be seen earliest at:
Pilon fracture is:
Following X-ray changes are seen in:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) OA

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The given X-ray shows Heberden’s nodes and Bouchard’s nodes in the hand, which are classical of osteoarthritis. DIP involvement is seen. There is subchondral sclerosis at the PIP and DIP joints along with osteophytes. The MCP joint is spared in OA.
  • ➤ The given X-ray shows Heberden’s nodes and Bouchard’s nodes in the hand, which are classical of osteoarthritis.
  • ➤ DIP involvement is seen.
  • ➤ There is subchondral sclerosis at the PIP and DIP joints along with osteophytes.
  • ➤ The MCP joint is spared in OA.

questions.text: Which of the following is a feature of osteogenesis imperfecta?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Blue sclera

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Blue sclera is a characteristic feature of osteogenesis imperfecta. The connective tissue in the sclera (the white part of the eye) is thinner and less opaque, allowing the underlying choroid to show through, giving the appearance of a blue or gray tint.
  • ➤ Blue sclera is a characteristic feature of osteogenesis imperfecta.
  • ➤ The connective tissue in the sclera (the white part of the eye) is thinner and less opaque, allowing the underlying choroid to show through, giving the appearance of a blue or gray tint.

questions.text: Thurston Holland sign is seen in:

A 30-year-old male suffers from road traffic accident where a car run-over his right leg. On examination, his vitals are stable and general physical examination is okay. His right leg is crushed with exposed muscles and bones. The debate about limbs survival can be resolved to an extent by MESS score. It includes all except:
A twisting injury of knee in flexed position would result in injury to all except:
Caffey’s disease occurs in:
questions.correct_answer: A. Infants below 6 months of age
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Infants below 6 months

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The onset of disease occurs before 6th month of life with resolution by 3 years of age.
  • ➤ The onset of disease occurs before 6th month of life with resolution by 3 years of age.

questions.text: Abatacept is used for:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Rheumatoid arthritis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Abatacept is a disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) that works by inhibiting T-cell activation and is approved for use in the treatment of moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis.
  • ➤ Abatacept is a disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD) that works by inhibiting T-cell activation and is approved for use in the treatment of moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis.

questions.text: Which of the following joints is not typically involved in arthrodesis?
Tube cast is applied for injuries of:
Open reduction and internal fixation is done for all of the following fractures except:
Which is the most common shoulder dislocation in epileptic patients?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Posterior dislocation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Posterior dislocation is the most common type of shoulder dislocation in epileptic patients. The violent, involuntary movements during a seizure are most likely to cause this type of dislocation.
  • ➤ Posterior dislocation is the most common type of shoulder dislocation in epileptic patients.
  • ➤ Posterior dislocation is the most common type of shoulder dislocation in epileptic patients.
  • ➤ The violent, involuntary movements during a seizure are most likely to cause this type of dislocation.
  • ➤ The violent, involuntary movements during a seizure are most likely to cause this type of dislocation.

questions.text: Increased bone density with hyperostosis seen in skeletal fluorosis is likely to occur when fluorine concentration in drinking water is above:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 10 ppm

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In some parts of India and Africa, where fluorine concentration in the drinking water maybe above 10 ppm, chronic fluorine intoxication (fluorosis) is endemic and results in skeletal anomalies.
  • ➤ In some parts of India and Africa, where fluorine concentration in the drinking water maybe above 10 ppm, chronic fluorine intoxication (fluorosis) is endemic and results in skeletal anomalies.

questions.text: All the following are true in infantile torticollis, except:
Tarsometatarsal amputation is also known as:
Locking of knee joint can be caused by: Osgood-Schlatter disease Loose body in knee joint Tuberculosis of knee Medial meniscal partial tear

options.label: A
options.text: ACL tear, LCL injury, Patellar dislocation

options.label: B
options.text: ACL tear, MCL injury, Medial meniscus tear

options.label: C
options.text: ACL tear, PCL injury, Lateral meniscus tear

options.label: D
options.text: MCL tear, LCL injury, Quadriceps tendon rupture

questions.correct_answer: B. ACL tear, MCL injury, Medial meniscus tear
questions.explanation: Ans. B) ACL tear, MCL injury, Medial meniscus tear

questions.text: Which nerve is most likely affected, based on the hand posture shown in the image?
All the following are used in osteoporosis except:

questions.text: Transient synovitis of the hip is characterized by all of the following, except:

options.label: B
options.text: ESR and white blood cell counts are usually normal

options.label: C
options.text: Ultrasound of the joint reveals widening of the joint space

options.label: D
options.text: The hip is typically held in adduction and internal rotation

questions.correct_answer: D. The hip is typically held in adduction and internal rotation

questions.text: Tardy ulnar nerve palsy is:
The bodies of spine are biconcave and are called “codfish spine”. This is most commonly seen in:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Osteomalacia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The biconcave appearance of vertebral bodies, known as "codfish spine," is most commonly associated with osteomalacia, which is caused by vitamin D deficiency and results in inadequate mineralization of the bone matrix. Top of Form
  • ➤ The biconcave appearance of vertebral bodies, known as "codfish spine," is most commonly associated with osteomalacia, which is caused by vitamin D deficiency and results in inadequate mineralization of the bone matrix. Top of Form

questions.text: A female patient complains of tingling and numbness in lateral 3 and half fingers. She usually wakes up in the night because of pain. She gets relief by hanging her hands at the edge of the bed. What is the correct pair of diagnosis and the clinical test that can be performed?
questions.correct_answer: C. Carpal tunnel syndrome, Durkan’s test
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Carpal tunnel syndrome, Durkan’s test

questions.text: A 55-year-old male presents with severe backache for 10 days and urinary incontinence with a history of intervertebral lumbar disc prolapse. There is no H/o fever or weight loss. What is the likely diagnosis?
